member.name: T:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteEscapeMethod
member.summary: Enumerates the ways the quote character may be represented when it appears in a quoted string.

member.name: F:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteEscapeMethod.Double
member.summary: The quote character is represented by two successive quote characters, similar to how quotes work in strings in Visual Basic .NET. This is the default.

member.name: F:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteEscapeMethod.EscapeCharacter
member.summary: The quote character is escaped by prefixing it with the designated escape character.

member.name: T:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteUsage
member.summary: Enumerates the ways values may be quoted when writing delimited text files.

member.name: F:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteUsage.AsNeeded
member.summary: Values are quoted only when necessary. This is the default.

member.name: F:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteUsage.AsNeededForColumnType
member.summary: All values in a column are quoted when some possible values of the type of the column require it.

member.name: F:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteUsage.Always
member.summary: Values are always quoted.

member.name: F:Extreme.Data.Text.QuoteUsage.Never
member.summary: Values are never quoted. Note that this may cause the resulting file to be invalid.
